The antibacterial activity of the HAp samples and HAp coated with essential oil of basil and
lavender samples was assessed using Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and
ATCC25922) bacterial strains. The qualitative antibacterial results of the tested samples obtained
by an adapted disc diffusion method are illustrated in Figure
measured in mmare presented in Table
The IR spectrum of the HAp-B sample in Figure 3b, as well as the second derivative and the
deconvoluted IR spectra from Figure 5, indicate only a few IR bands specific to basil EO in
comparison with the bands specific to lavender EO. In [23,26], it was shown that the basil and
lavender EOs have many characteristic IR bands in the 800–1800 cm
IR spectrum, there were a few IR bands specific to the basil EO (Table 2, Figures 3 and 5). In the IR
spectrum of HAp-L, more IR bands specific to lavender EO were identified (Table 2, Figures 4 and
6). This emphasizes the fact that the lavender EO was better adsorbed on the surface of
The antibacterial activity of the HAp samples and HAp coated with essential oil of basil and
lavender samples was assessed using Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and
ATCC 25922) bacterial strains. The qualitative antibacterial results of the tested samples
obtained by an adapted disc diffusion method are illustrated in Figure 7, and the inhibition zone
diameters measured in mm are presented in Table 4.
Qualitative assay of the inhibitory activity of HAp, HAp-B and HAp-L samples against
The results of the antibacterial assays emphasized that HAp pellet powders exhibited no
antimicrobial activity against the tested Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacterial strains.
The results indicated that HAp-L displayed good antibacterial activity against MRSA,
ATCC 25922 microbial strains, while the antibacterial activity of HAp-B samples
ATCC 25922 was not so well evidenced. It can be observed
that HAp-L was strongly inhibitory against all tested bacterial strains (Figure 7c,f,i). The results also
Qualitative assay of the inhibitory activity of HAp, HAp-B and HAp-L samples against
The results of the antibacterial assays emphasized that HAp pellet powders exhibited no
antimicrobial activity against the tested Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacterial strains.
The results indicated that HAp-L displayed good antibacterial activity against MRSA,
ATCC 25922 microbial strains, while the antibacterial activity of HAp-B samples
ATCC 25922 was not so well evidenced. It can be observed
that HAp-L was strongly inhibitory against all tested bacterial strains (Figure
also suggested that HAp-B was moderately inhibitory against
